episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including historical protests using snowmen in Brussels, the unique behavior of Harris Hawks, the personal life of Pope Innocent the Eighth, and a humorous incident involving the accidental destruction of a neolithic tomb mistaken for a picnic table.

facts.fact: In 1511, the people of Brussels protested against the government by filling the city with dozens of pornographic snowmen.
Harris Hawks stand on each other's shoulders to get a better view.
Pope Innocent the Eighth was given the nickname The Honest because he was the first Pope to acknowledge that he had illegitimate children.
Spanish construction workers recently accidentally destroyed a 6,000-year-old neolithic tomb that looked like a picnic table and replaced it with a new and better-looking picnic table.
